metadata.Title: CVE-2021-41990 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
The gmp plugin in strongSwan before 5.9.4 has a remote integer overflow viaa crafted certificate with an RSASSA-PSS signature. For example, this canbe triggered by an unrelated self-signed CA certificate sent by aninitiator. Remote code execution cannot occur.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-41990` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

charon-cmd - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
charon-systemd - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
libcharon-extauth-plugins - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
libcharon-standard-plugins - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
libstrongswan - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-charon - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-libcharon - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-nm - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-pki - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-scepclient - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-starter - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-swanctl - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-tnc-base - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-tnc-client - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-tnc-ifmap - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-tnc-pdp - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
strongswan-tnc-server - 5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: strongswan package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.8.2-1ubuntu3.3').
